member.name: T:VRageRender.Animations.MyAnimationClip
member.summary: An animation clip is a set of keyframes with associated bones. VRAGE TODO: Any link to actual animation collection? Or at least to rest pose? Please?

member.name: T:VRageRender.Animations.MyAnimationClip.BoneState
member.summary: BoneState is a rotation and translation of the bone. It would be easy to extend this to include scaling as well.

members.member:
An Keyframe extends rotation and translation of the bone by specifying time of the event.
Beware, this class is used also in MWM builder and changing it to struct may cause problems during MWM generation.

member.summary: Simple pool allocator for bone results.

member.summary: Set the link to default pose = default bone positions and rotations given when using this allocator. If null is given, rest pose is used.

member.summary: Allocate array of bones from pool. Bones are in the rest (bind) position by default.

member.summary: Create animation layer with unique name. Parameter insertionIndex can be left -1 to add the layer at the end. If layer with same name is already present, method fails and returns null.

member.summary: Trigger an action in all layers. If there is a transition having given (non-null) name, it is followed immediatelly. Conditions of transition are ignored.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Animations.MyCharacterBone
member.summary:
Bones in this model are represented by this class, which allows a bone to have more detail associatd with it.
This class allows you to manipulate the local coordinate system for objects by changing the scaling, translation, and rotation. These are indepenent of the bind transformation originally supplied for the model. So, the actual transformation for a bone is the product of the:
Scaling Bind scaling (scaling removed from the bind transform) Rotation Translation Bind Transformation Parent Absolute Transformation

member.name: F:VRageRender.Animations.MyCharacterBone.m_parent
member.summary: Any parent for this bone

member.name: F:VRageRender.Animations.MyCharacterBone.m_bindTransform
member.summary: The bind transform is the transform for this bone as loaded from the original model. It's the base pose. I do remove any scaling, though.

member.name: F:VRageRender.Animations.MyCharacterBone.m_translation
member.summary: Any translation applied to the bone

member.name: F:VRageRender.Animations.MyCharacterBone.m_rotation
member.summary: Any rotation applied to the bone

member.name: F:VRageRender.Animations.MyCharacterBone.m_changed
member.summary: indicates whether bone needs recalculation

member.summary: The bone name

member.summary: The bone bind transform

This is kinda your universal array operator splice().
The only thing is we cannot move elements with this.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageDrawCommands
member.summary: Render message representing a repeatable command list.

member.name: F:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageSetCameraViewMatrix.Smooth
member.summary: Whether this camera movement is part of smooth camera motion, as opposed to a sharp camera cut.

member.name: F:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageSetInstanceBuffer.InstanceData
member.summary: Fill in only the relevant data. Data ouside of the specified range would not be used.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageSwitchRenderSettings
member.summary: 1 at the end is naming convention from DX, saying this is newer version (for Dx11 render).

member.name: F:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageType.Draw
member.summary: Draw message Skipped when renderer is falling behind and has to process multiple enqueued frames (only handled in last frame before draw) Draw sprite, Draw light

member.name: F:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageType.DebugDraw
member.summary: Debug Draw message, in render11 these messages are queued internally Skipped when renderer is falling behind and has to process multiple enqueued frames (only handled in last frame before draw) Draw sprite, debug draw...

member.name: F:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageType.StateChangeOnce
member.summary: State change which can be applied only once, not applied when rendering same frame second time or more Add render object, remove render object...

member.name: F:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageType.StateChangeEvery
member.summary: State change which must be applied every time, even when drawing same frame multiple times Move render object, other interpolation messages

member.name: T:VRageRender.Messages.MyRenderMessageUpdateRenderEnvironment
member.summary: The difference between environment and RenderSettings is that environment are game play values, on the other hand render settings are render internal/debugging values

members.member:
c-tor - generic way for collecting resources
assetName - just for debug output

member.summary: Replacement character shown when we don't have something in our texture. Normally, this would be \uFFFD, but BMFontGen refuses to generate it, so I put its glyph at \u25A1 (empty square)

member.name: T:VRageRender.MyMessagePool
member.summary: TODO: This should use some better sync, it could introduce delays with current state 1) Use spin lock 2) Lock only queue, not whole dictionary 3) Test count first and when it's insufficient, create new message, both should be safe to do out of any lock 4) Custom consumer/producer non-locking (except resize) queue could be better (maybe overkill)

member.name: T:VRageRender.MySharedData
member.summary: Data shared between render and update

member.name: M:VRageRender.MySharedData.BeforeUpdate
member.summary: Refresh data from render (visible objects, render messages)

member.name: M:VRageRender.MyUpdateData.CommitUpdateFrame(VRage.Library.Threading.SpinLockRef)
member.summary: Commits current frame as atomic operation and prepares new frame

member.name: M:VRageRender.MyUpdateData.GetRenderFrame(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets next frame for rendering, can return null in case there's nothing for rendering (no update frame submitted). When isPreFrame is true, don't handle draw messages, just process update messages and call method again. Pre frame must release messages and must be returned. Final frame is kept unmodified in queue, in case of slower update, so we can interpolate and draw frame again.

member.name: M:VRageRender.MyUpdateData.ReturnPreFrame(VRageRender.MyUpdateFrame)
member.summary: PreFrame must be empty in this place

member.name: T:VRageRender.MyUpdateFrame
member.summary: Contains data produced by update frame, sent to render in thread-safe manner

member.name: T:VRageRender.SpriteScissorStack
member.summary: Stores stack of scissor rectangles where top rectangle has already been cut using all the rectangles below it, so that only one rectangle is checked during scissor test.

member.summary: Cuts the destination rectangle using top of the scissor stack. Source rectangle is modified using scaled change of destination as well.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Utils.MyWingedEdgeMesh.SortFreeFaces
member.summary: Sorts the list of free faces. This ensures that subsequent face allocations will return increasing sequence of face indices, unless interrupted by face deallocation. This can be useful in some algorithms that rely on ordering of the face indices.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Utils.MyWingedEdgeMesh.CheckFreeEntryConsistency
member.summary: Checks for loops in the meshe's tables' freed entries

member.name: T:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap
member.summary:
Interface describing a clipmap.
The clipmap is a class responsible for managing the visibility state of voxel objects.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.Cells
member.summary: Provide an enumeration of all clipmap cells the clipmap deems visible.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.Actor
member.summary:
Get the actor bound to this clipmap if any.
This reference may not be thread safe.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.Size
member.summary: The size in voxels of this clipmap.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.Update(VRageMath.MatrixD@,VRageMath.BoundingFrustumD,System.Single)
member.summary:
Update cell visibility based on a view frustum.
Cells visibility should be updated based on the view frustum.
member.param: View matrix relative to the clipmap.
The view frustum for the current camera.
Distance to the far clipping plane from the view matrix.

members.member:
Bind to the cell handler, which is the component responsible for creating cells on behalf of the clipmap.
It should only be legal to provide the cell handler once to a clipmap. Any future calls should be met with The cell handler to use for this clipmap.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.Unload
member.summary: Unload all data for this clipmap, this is only invoked at shutdown.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.InvalidateRange(VRageMath.Vector3I,VRageMath.Vector3I)
member.summary: Let the clipmap know the provided range needs to be recalculated.
member.param: min range in voxels
max range in voxels

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.InvalidateAll
member.summary:
Invalidate all data in the clipmap.
This should not trigger recalculation immediately, that should happen upon the next update.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyClipmap.DebugDraw
member.summary:
Debug draw the contents of the clipmap.
For debug use only.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController
member.summary:
Interface describing a lod controller for a voxel object.
The lod controller is a class responsible for managing the visibility state of voxel objects and their parts.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.Cells
member.summary: Provide an enumeration of all voxel cells the controller deems visible.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.Actor
member.summary:
Get the actor bound to this clipmap if any.
This reference may not be thread safe.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.Size
member.summary: The size in voxels of this voxel object.

member.name: E:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.Loaded
member.summary: Event raised whenever the lod controller finishes updating all cells ton the current view.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.Update(VRageMath.MatrixD@,VRageMath.BoundingFrustumD,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Update cell visibility based on a view frustum.
Cells visibility should be updated based on the view frustum.
member.param: View matrix relative to the clipmap.
The view frustum for the current camera.
Distance to the far clipping plane from the view matrix.
Whether the camera motion is smooth or not. Affects how the updated view may draw it's meshes.

members.member:
Bind to the cell handler, which is the component responsible for creating cells on behalf of the clipmap.
It should only be legal to provide the cell handler once to a clipmap. Any future calls should be met with The cell handler to use for this clipmap.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.Unload
member.summary: Unload all data for this clipmap, this is only invoked at shutdown.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.InvalidateRange(VRageMath.Vector3I,VRageMath.Vector3I)
member.summary: Let the clipmap know the provided range needs to be recalculated.
member.param: min range in voxels
max range in voxels

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.InvalidateAll
member.summary:
Invalidate all data in the clipmap.
This should not trigger recalculation immediately, that should happen upon the next update.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyLodController.DebugDraw(VRageMath.MatrixD@)
member.summary:
Debug draw the contents of the clipmap.
For debug use only.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Voxels.VisibilityChange
member.summary: Signature for the event fired once the visibility of a voxel actor cell changes.
member.param: The cell's offset.
The lod of the cell.
Whether the cell if visible after the change.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Voxels.MyVoxelActorTransitionMode
member.summary: Specifies

member.name: T:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor
member.summary:
Defines a render actor for a voxel entity.
Voxels entities differ from other entities in that they have multi-part meshes, where each part can be shown at different levels of detail.
These parts are called cells or chunks.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.Id
member.summary: Render Object Id for this actor.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.Size
member.summary: Size in voxels of this actor.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.TransitionMode
member.summary:
Transition mode used for visibility changes to meshes in this clipmap.
This will also affect cell updates.
member.remarks: It is an error to change the mode when there is an open batch.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.CreateCell(VRageMath.Vector3D,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Create a clipmap cell.
Cell add event is fired once the cell is actually visible.
member.param: Offset of the mesh.
Mesh lod, used to calculate scale.
Whether to raise an event for this operation.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.DeleteCell(VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Destroy a voxel cell in this actor.
Once a the cell is no longer visible and the notify flag was set, the CellChange event is raised.
member.param: The cell to remove
Whether to raise an event for this operation.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.BeginBatch(System.Nullable{VRageRender.Voxels.MyVoxelActorTransitionMode})
member.summary:
Begin caching add/remove update operations.
To dispatch them all at once call EndBatch();
member.param: Optionally switch into this transition mode before beginning the batch.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.EndBatch(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispatch all queued operations.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.IsBatching
member.summary: Whether this actor is currently batching cell changes.

member.name: E:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.CellChange
member.summary:
Event fired when a cell is added or removed.
The event is only fired when the operation is done (which could be asynchronous, but not on a different thread as the renderer).
The event is only fired for operations that specify the notify flag = true.

member.name: E:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActor.Move
member.summary: Event fired when the actor moves.

member.name: T:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell
member.summary: Represents a chunk of voxel mesh in a voxel actor.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell.Offset
member.summary: Position and lod of this voxel cell.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell.Lod
member.summary: Lod index of this cell.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell.UpdateMesh(VRageRender.Voxels.MyVoxelRenderCellData@,VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelUpdateBatch@)
member.summary: Update the mesh inside this voxel cell.
member.param: Render data for the cell.

member.name: M:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell.SetVisible(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the visibility of the cell. False means the cell will not be considered at all during rendering.
member.param: Wether the cell should be visible or not.
Whther to raise the cell change event form the voxel actor after this visibility change is complete.

member.name: P:VRageRender.Voxels.IMyVoxelActorCell.Visible
member.summary: Weather this cell is visible or not.

member.name: F:VRageRender.Voxels.MyClipmap.EnableUpdate
